trans-unit.source: Table Setup

seg-source.mrk: Table Setup

trans-unit.source: The table setup splits the content type settings to different tables (records) and is configured on the DMS Table Setup FastTab in the DMS Document Library page. It defines for which records (table number and Microsoft Dynamics NAV table filter) the content type should be visible in the DocumentBox. Different MetaData (refer to topic “MetaData” on page 1) and different table filters (refer to topic “SharePoint Table Filter” on page 1 and topic “Microsoft Dynamics NAV Table Filter” on page 1) can be defined for each table setup. Additionally, the table setup holds a release status certification for plausibility and integrity. Only released table setup will be displayed in the DocumentBox.

seg-source.mrk: The table setup splits the content type settings to different tables (records) and is configured on the DMS Table Setup FastTab in the DMS Document Library page.
It defines for which records (table number and Microsoft Dynamics NAV table filter) the content type should be visible in the DocumentBox.

Different MetaData (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref425781031" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“MetaData” on page 1</MadCap:xref>) and different table filters (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref425781036" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“SharePoint Table Filter” on page 1</MadCap:xref> and topic <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref425341841" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Microsoft Dynamics NAV Table Filter” on page 1</MadCap:xref>) can be defined for each table setup.
Additionally, the table setup holds a release status certification for plausibility and integrity.
Only released table setup will be displayed in the DocumentBox.

trans-unit.source: : Table Setup of a Content Type on the DMS Document Library page

seg-source.mrk: : Table Setup of a Content Type on the DMS Document Library page

trans-unit.source: Status

seg-source.mrk: Status

trans-unit.source: Indicates the status of the table setup. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the status of the table setup.
The options are:

trans-unit.source: Open – Changes on MetaData or table filters are possible.

seg-source.mrk: Open – Changes on MetaData or table filters are possible.

trans-unit.source: Released – Changes on MetaData or table filters are not possible. The DocumentBox shows only released table setups. During release, the configuration data are validated for plausibility and integrity, displaying any errors.

seg-source.mrk: Released – Changes on MetaData or table filters are not possible.
The DocumentBox shows only released table setups.
During release, the configuration data are validated for plausibility and integrity, displaying any errors.

trans-unit.source: MetaData

seg-source.mrk: MetaData

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether a MetaData definition (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref425781031" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“MetaData” on page 1</MadCap:xref>) is configured for the current table setup.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates whether a MetaData definition (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref425781031" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“MetaData” on page 1</MadCap:xref>) is configured for the current table setup.

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether a SharePoint table filter (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref425781036" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“SharePoint Table Filter” on page 1</MadCap:xref>) is configured for the current table setup.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates whether a SharePoint table filter (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref425781036" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“SharePoint Table Filter” on page 1</MadCap:xref>) is configured for the current table setup.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Dynamics NAV Table Filter

seg-source.mrk: Indicates whether a Microsoft Dynamics NAV table filter (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref425342311" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Microsoft Dynamics NAV Table Filter” on page 1</MadCap:xref>) is configured for the current table setup.

trans-unit.source: Folder Formula

seg-source.mrk: Folder Formula

trans-unit.source: Enables the storage of files in a folder and is a formula field that can contain variables to be used as folder definition. Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Table Setups.htm#Folders" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Folders for Libraries” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

seg-source.mrk: Enables the storage of files in a folder and is a formula field that can contain variables to be used as folder definition.
Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Table Setups.htm#Folders" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Folders for Libraries” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Last Modification Date

seg-source.mrk: Last Modification Date

trans-unit.source: Displays the last date of modification of any table setup’s sub-tables, such as MetaData or table filters.

seg-source.mrk: Displays the last date of modification of any table setup’s sub-tables, such as MetaData or table filters.

seg-source.mrk: Last Modification Time

trans-unit.source: Displays the last time of modification according to the modification date.

seg-source.mrk: Displays the last time of modification according to the modification date.

trans-unit.source: Modified by User

seg-source.mrk: Modified by User

trans-unit.source: Displays the user according to the last modification.

seg-source.mrk: Displays the user according to the last modification.

trans-unit.source: Library Relative Url Formula

seg-source.mrk: Library Relative Url Formula

trans-unit.source: Indicates a dynamic, record based URL instead of the fixed URL of a Document Library. Enter the full relative URL and then use "[Field Name]" to get values of the corresponding field of the currently selected record.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates a dynamic, record based URL instead of the fixed URL of a Document Library.
Enter the full relative URL and then use "[Field Name]" to get values of the corresponding field of the currently selected record.

trans-unit.source: For example, if a customer has a project website (e.g. websites/dms/projects), that contains sub-websites for each project based on the job's No. field (e.g. PR1234), there are two ways to enter the Library Relative Url Formula:

seg-source.mrk: For example, if a customer has a project website (e.g. websites/dms/projects), that contains sub-websites for each project based on the job's No.
field (e.g. PR1234), there are two ways to enter the Library Relative Url Formula:

trans-unit.source: "websites/dms/projects/[No.]"

seg-source.mrk: "websites/dms/projects/[No.]"

trans-unit.source: "[DMS Website Url]", and create a new field in the Job table that contains the value "websites/dms/projects/<Job No.>" (where <Job No.> = e.g. "PR1234")

seg-source.mrk: "[DMS Website Url]", and create a new field in the Job table that contains the value "websites/dms/projects/<Job No.>" (where <Job No.> = e.g. "PR1234")

trans-unit.source: Folders for Libraries

seg-source.mrk: Folders for Libraries

trans-unit.source: After there are more than 5,000 elements in a SharePoint list, the filtered fields must be managed by indexed columns. Document libraries are technically lists, with a document field to store the files. Managing the indexed columns is fine, but can still create problems with the file upload via the SOAP web service, which DMS is using. A way to avoid the limitation of 5,000 elements is to upload files into folders. Each folder can again contain 5,000 elements, and so on. However, since a “folder” is an element, there should only be a maximum of 5,000 folders inside a folder, again.

seg-source.mrk: After there are more than 5,000 elements in a SharePoint list, the filtered fields must be managed by indexed columns.
Document libraries are technically lists, with a document field to store the files.
Managing the indexed columns is fine, but can still create problems with the file upload via the SOAP web service, which DMS is using.
A way to avoid the limitation of 5,000 elements is to upload files into folders.
Each folder can again contain 5,000 elements, and so on.
However, since a “folder” is an element, there should only be a maximum of 5,000 folders inside a folder, again.

trans-unit.source: In the DMS Table Setup FastTab, the Folder Formula field enables the storage of files in a folder. Thereby, more than 5,000 files can be managed (especially uploaded) together with DMS. This is a formula field that can contain variables to be used as folder definition. Because this field is applied on the table setup configuration, all fields from the record can be used to create folders, as well as some system variables:

seg-source.mrk: In the DMS Table Setup FastTab, the Folder Formula field enables the storage of files in a folder.
Thereby, more than 5,000 files can be managed (especially uploaded) together with DMS.
This is a formula field that can contain variables to be used as folder definition.
Because this field is applied on the table setup configuration, all fields from the record can be used to create folders, as well as some system variables:

trans-unit.source: “[MM]” can be used for the current month (e.g. “02” or “12”)

seg-source.mrk: “[MM]” can be used for the current month (e.g. “02” or “12”)

trans-unit.source: “[DD]” can be used for the current day (e.g. “01” or “27”)

seg-source.mrk: “[DD]” can be used for the current day (e.g. “01” or “27”)

trans-unit.source: “[YYYY]” can be used for the current year (e.g. “2017”)

seg-source.mrk: “[YYYY]” can be used for the current year (e.g. “2017”)

trans-unit.source: “[No.]” is an example to retrieve the information from the current “No.” field of the current record in the current table

seg-source.mrk: “[No.]” is an example to retrieve the information from the current “No.” field of the current record in the current table

trans-unit.source: “[Description]” is an example to retrieve the information of the “Description” field

seg-source.mrk: “[Description]” is an example to retrieve the information of the “Description” field

trans-unit.source: Variables can also be added to more complex structures. “[YYYY]/[MM]” will create a folder “2017” and a subfolder “03” (for March) within. Values of the fields will be translated into valid URL path names by replacing the characters \/.?&%#{}~ with an underline (“_”). Before uploading the file, the existence of the folders is tested. Folders that do not exist will be created. Therefore, the user must have enough rights to create folders if necessary and upload a file into the folder.

seg-source.mrk: Variables can also be added to more complex structures.
“[YYYY]/[MM]” will create a folder “2017” and a subfolder “03” (for March) within.
Values of the fields will be translated into valid URL path names by replacing the characters \/.?&%#{}~ with an underline (“_”).
Before uploading the file, the existence of the folders is tested.
Folders that do not exist will be created.
Therefore, the user must have enough rights to create folders if necessary and upload a file into the folder.

trans-unit.source: The Document Box filters all the files, regardless of where they are stored in the SharePoint list’s folder structure. All documents that apply the DMS’ Table Setup SharePoint filter will be displayed plainly under the content type inside the Document Box. When editing the metadata, the absolute file path on the top of the page displays the correct path to the file, including folders.

seg-source.mrk: The Document Box filters all the files, regardless of where they are stored in the SharePoint list’s folder structure.
All documents that apply the DMS’ Table Setup SharePoint filter will be displayed plainly under the content type inside the Document Box.
When editing the metadata, the absolute file path on the top of the page displays the correct path to the file, including folders.

trans-unit.source: More information about folder limitations can be found in the following links:

seg-source.mrk: More information about folder limitations can be found in the following links:

trans-unit.source: SharePoint folder limitations that must be observed inside projects: https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc262787(v=office.16).aspx#ListLibrary

seg-source.mrk: SharePoint folder limitations that must be observed inside projects: https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc262787(v=office.16).aspx#ListLibrary

trans-unit.source: Column indexing that should be made within SharePoint for each filtered field in document libraries with a huge number of documents (more than 5,000): https://www.codeproject.com/Articles/1076854/Overcoming-the-List-View-Threshold-in-SharePoint-C

seg-source.mrk: Column indexing that should be made within SharePoint for each filtered field in document libraries with a huge number of documents (more than 5,000): https://www.codeproject.com/Articles/1076854/Overcoming-the-List-View-Threshold-in-SharePoint-C

trans-unit.source: Note

seg-source.mrk: Note

trans-unit.source: No column indexing was done when the current Library Set was created because it is technically impossible with SOAP. Therefore, users must manage the column indexing of the filtered fields within SharePoint or the folder structure will not be visible. Column indexing must be completed before 5000 elements are reached; subsequent adjustments are not possible.

seg-source.mrk: No column indexing was done when the current Library Set was created because it is technically impossible with SOAP.
Therefore, users must manage the column indexing of the filtered fields within SharePoint or the folder structure will not be visible.
Column indexing must be completed before 5000 elements are reached; subsequent adjustments are not possible.

trans-unit.source: DMS Table Setup Overview

seg-source.mrk: DMS Table Setup Overview

trans-unit.source: To view all configured table setups for a specific table number, open the DMS Table Setup Overview page from the cc|dms menu by clicking Setup > DMS Table Setup Overview.

seg-source.mrk: To view all configured table setups for a specific table number, open the DMS Table Setup Overview page from the cc|dms menu by clicking Setup > DMS Table Setup Overview.

trans-unit.source: : Table Setup for Specific Table Numbers

seg-source.mrk: : Table Setup for Specific Table Numbers

trans-unit.source: MetaData

seg-source.mrk: MetaData

trans-unit.source: MetaData defines the fields (columns) of a document library for the content type and a specific table setup. For the DocumentBox’s actions “File Upload”, “Show MetaData” and “Edit MetaData”, only the configured fields will be shown in the dialog (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Document Actions.htm#_Ref425177186" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Document Actions” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: MetaData defines the fields (columns) of a document library for the content type and a specific table setup.

For the DocumentBox’s actions “File Upload”, “Show MetaData” and “Edit MetaData”, only the configured fields will be shown in the dialog (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Document Actions.htm#_Ref425177186" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Document Actions” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: Furthermore, MetaData provides the document with additional information to filter and find the documents for the DocumentBox and in SharePoint. The information sources (Field Class) can either be record specific, looked up or system values.

seg-source.mrk: Furthermore, MetaData provides the document with additional information to filter and find the documents for the DocumentBox and in SharePoint.
The information sources (Field Class) can either be record specific, looked up or system values.

trans-unit.source: : MetaData Configuration Worksheet

seg-source.mrk: : MetaData Configuration Worksheet

trans-unit.source: Field Class

seg-source.mrk: Field Class

trans-unit.source: Defines the source of information, as further indicated in the Default Value / Field field. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: Defines the source of information, as further indicated in the Default Value / Field field.
The options are:

trans-unit.source: Value – Enter a user-defined value (constant) that will be used for upload as the default.

seg-source.mrk: Value – Enter a user-defined value (constant) that will be used for upload as the default.

trans-unit.source: Field – Use the lookup in the Default Value / Field field to select a field value of the current record (table setup) that will be used as the default value.

seg-source.mrk: Field – Use the lookup in the Default Value / Field field to select a field value of the current record (table setup) that will be used as the default value.

trans-unit.source: Option – Use the lookup in the Default Value / Field field to enter option values. Later, those values can be used for selection. The Option Code is a unique value, whereas the Option Value represents the actually uploaded value.

seg-source.mrk: Option – Use the lookup in the Default Value / Field field to enter option values.
Later, those values can be used for selection.
The Option Code is a unique value, whereas the Option Value represents the actually uploaded value.

trans-unit.source: Date Formula – Enter a date formula that is calculated before uploading a document.

seg-source.mrk: Date Formula – Enter a date formula that is calculated before uploading a document.

trans-unit.source: System – Use the lookup in the Default Value / Field field to select a system value from a list. The options are: User ID, Workdate, System Date, System Time, Company Code.

seg-source.mrk: System – Use the lookup in the Default Value / Field field to select a system value from a list.
The options are: User ID, Workdate, System Date, System Time, Company Code.

trans-unit.source: File – Use the lookup in the Default Value / Field field to select file information from a list. The options are: File Name, File Path, File Extension, Absolute File Name.

seg-source.mrk: File – Use the lookup in the Default Value / Field field to select file information from a list.
The options are: File Name, File Path, File Extension, Absolute File Name.

trans-unit.source: Lookup – Use the lookup in the Default Value / Field field to retrieve a value from another record from any Microsoft Dynamics NAV table. The target record can either be a filtered single result, or selected by the user from a page.

seg-source.mrk: Lookup – Use the lookup in the Default Value / Field field to retrieve a value from another record from any Microsoft Dynamics NAV table.
The target record can either be a filtered single result, or selected by the user from a page.

trans-unit.source: After entering the target Table ID in the Lookup Table No. field, the Default Value / Field field shows all fields of the target table. Select the field and then click the AssistEdit to filter the target table.

seg-source.mrk: After entering the target Table ID in the Lookup Table No.
field, the Default Value / Field field shows all fields of the target table.
Select the field and then click the AssistEdit to filter the target table.

trans-unit.source: Enter a value in the Lookup Page ID field to show the filtered result in a page and make the user select the target record. Without a value in the Lookup Page ID field, depending on the Lookup Action field, the value of the first record or the last record in the filtered list will be used as default value, or no value at all.

seg-source.mrk: Enter a value in the Lookup Page ID field to show the filtered result in a page and make the user select the target record.

Without a value in the Lookup Page ID field, depending on the Lookup Action field, the value of the first record or the last record in the filtered list will be used as default value, or no value at all.

trans-unit.source: Defines the visibility of the MetaData item. The options are:

trans-unit.source: Standard – The field (and thereby its value) are always visible.

seg-source.mrk: Standard – The field (and thereby its value) are always visible.

trans-unit.source: Extended – The field will be invisible unless the user clicks Show Extended Fields on the Define, Show and Edit MetaData dialogs.

trans-unit.source: Hidden – The field is always invisible but the value will be uploaded or modified in the background.

trans-unit.source: Identifies the page number to open when the user clicks the lookup on the Define or Edit MetaData dialogs. The page’s source table must match the lookup table to avoid errors.

trans-unit.source: First Record – The field value of the first record from the filtered list will be used.

seg-source.mrk: First Record – The field value of the first record from the filtered list will be used.

trans-unit.source: Last Record – The field value of the last record from the filtered list will be used.

seg-source.mrk: Last Record – The field value of the last record from the filtered list will be used.

trans-unit.source: No Record – The value will be empty and no record will be selected after filtering.

seg-source.mrk: No Record – The value will be empty and no record will be selected after filtering.

seg-source.mrk: Field No.
Linked Lookup

trans-unit.source: Identifies which field of the looked up value to be received; used with the Field Name Linked Lookup field. Refer to section “Example – Create a Linked Lookup” on page 1 for more information.

seg-source.mrk: Identifies which field of the looked up value to be received; used with the Field Name Linked Lookup field.
Refer to section <MadCap:xref href="#Example" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Example – Create a Linked Lookup” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Field Name Linked Lookup

seg-source.mrk: Field Name Linked Lookup

trans-unit.source: Indicates another field name from this configuration to retrieve additional values if a lookup is processed. This field links the current metadata field with the field where the lookup is pressed. Refer to section <MadCap:xref href="#Example" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Example – Create a Linked Lookup” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates another field name from this configuration to retrieve additional values if a lookup is processed.
This field links the current metadata field with the field where the lookup is pressed.
Refer to section <MadCap:xref href="#Example" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Example – Create a Linked Lookup” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Value by Lookup only

seg-source.mrk: Value by Lookup only

trans-unit.source: If selected, the user cannot enter a value by keyboard in the metadata dialog; the Lookup must be used to select a value. Refer to section <MadCap:xref href="#Example" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Example – Create a Linked Lookup” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

seg-source.mrk: If selected, the user cannot enter a value by keyboard in the metadata dialog; the Lookup must be used to select a value.
Refer to section <MadCap:xref href="#Example" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Example – Create a Linked Lookup” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Sorting Position

seg-source.mrk: Sorting Position

trans-unit.source: Displays an ongoing number that represents the sort order for the dialog. This field is system-generated and should only be changed due to data inconsistencies.

seg-source.mrk: Displays an ongoing number that represents the sort order for the dialog.
This field is system-generated and should only be changed due to data inconsistencies.

trans-unit.source: Example – Create a Linked Lookup

seg-source.mrk: Example – Create a Linked Lookup

trans-unit.source: This example explains how to create a linked lookup of a customer name to a customer number when uploading a new document.

seg-source.mrk: This example explains how to create a linked lookup of a customer name to a customer number when uploading a new document.

trans-unit.source: To set the customer name to the metadata definition dialog when the user clicks on the lookup for the customer number during upload:

seg-source.mrk: To set the customer name to the metadata definition dialog when the user clicks on the lookup for the customer number during upload:

trans-unit.source: Define a metadata field to send the contact number to (SharePoint field name = CCDMS_Customer_No) and set the fields to Class = Lookup, Lookup Table No. = 5050, Lookup Field No. = 1, Lookup Page ID = 5052, Value by Lookup only = true

seg-source.mrk: Define a metadata field to send the contact number to (SharePoint field name = CCDMS_Customer_No) and set the fields to Class = Lookup, Lookup Table No.
= 5050, Lookup Field No.
= 1, Lookup Page ID = 5052, Value by Lookup only = true

trans-unit.source: Define a metadata field to send the contact name to and set the fields to Class = Lookup, Editable = false, Lookup Table No. = 5050, Lookup Field No. = 2, Linked Lookup Field Name = CCDMS_Customer_No, Linked Lookup Field No. = 2

seg-source.mrk: Define a metadata field to send the contact name to and set the fields to Class = Lookup, Editable = false, Lookup Table No.
= 5050, Lookup Field No.
= 2, Linked Lookup Field Name = CCDMS_Customer_No, Linked Lookup Field No.

trans-unit.source: SharePoint Table Filter

seg-source.mrk: SharePoint Table Filter

trans-unit.source: A SharePoint Table Filter defines which files in the document library are displayed in the DocumentBox. Only the documents from the document library that meet the filter criteria are listed.

seg-source.mrk: A SharePoint Table Filter defines which files in the document library are displayed in the DocumentBox.
Only the documents from the document library that meet the filter criteria are listed.

trans-unit.source: : SharePoint Table Filter Worksheet

seg-source.mrk: : SharePoint Table Filter Worksheet

trans-unit.source: The fields in the Edit DMS SharePoint Table Filter page are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields in the Edit DMS SharePoint Table Filter page are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Field

seg-source.mrk: Field

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: Field Name

seg-source.mrk: Field Name

trans-unit.source: Identifies the internal (static) SharePoint field (column) name to be filtered.

seg-source.mrk: Identifies the internal (static) SharePoint field (column) name to be filtered.

trans-unit.source: Field Type

seg-source.mrk: Field Type

trans-unit.source: Displays the type of the SharePoint column. This value is not editable in Microsoft Dynamics NAV.

seg-source.mrk: Displays the type of the SharePoint column.
This value is not editable in Microsoft Dynamics NAV.

trans-unit.source: Field Caption

seg-source.mrk: Field Caption

trans-unit.source: Shows the display name (caption) of the SharePoint column. This value is not editable in Microsoft Dynamics NAV.

seg-source.mrk: Shows the display name (caption) of the SharePoint column.
This value is not editable in Microsoft Dynamics NAV.

trans-unit.source: Field Class

seg-source.mrk: Field Class

trans-unit.source: Defines the source of the filter value, as further indicated in the Default Value / Field field. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: Defines the source of the filter value, as further indicated in the Default Value / Field field.
The options are:

trans-unit.source: Const – Enter a user-defined value (constant) that will be used as a fixed filter value (such as document type).

seg-source.mrk: Const – Enter a user-defined value (constant) that will be used as a fixed filter value (such as document type).

trans-unit.source: Field – Use the lookup in the Default Value / Field field to select a field value of the current record (table setup) that will be used as the filter value.

seg-source.mrk: Field – Use the lookup in the Default Value / Field field to select a field value of the current record (table setup) that will be used as the filter value.

trans-unit.source: Date Formula – Enter a date formula that is calculated before filtering the document list.

seg-source.mrk: Date Formula – Enter a date formula that is calculated before filtering the document list.

trans-unit.source: System – Use the lookup in the Default Value / Field field to select a system value from a list. The options are: User ID, Workdate, System Date, System Time, Company Code.

seg-source.mrk: System – Use the lookup in the Default Value / Field field to select a system value from a list.
The options are: User ID, Workdate, System Date, System Time, Company Code.

trans-unit.source: Date Formula – Microsoft Dynamics NAV formula to calculate the date

This field is not editable.

trans-unit.source: Displays the length of characters of the SharePoint column. This value is not editable in Microsoft Dynamics NAV.

This value is not editable in Microsoft Dynamics NAV.

trans-unit.source: Format Property

seg-source.mrk: Format Property

trans-unit.source: Defines the formatting of the default value. The number is equal to the Microsoft Dynamics NAV format definitions (C/AL “Format Property”).

seg-source.mrk: Defines the formatting of the default value.
The number is equal to the Microsoft Dynamics NAV format definitions (C/AL “Format Property”).

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Dynamics NAV Table Filter

seg-source.mrk: Microsoft Dynamics NAV Table Filter

trans-unit.source: A Microsoft Dynamics NAV Table Filter defines the display of the content type in the DocumentBox only for appropriate records that meet the filter criteria. Thereby is it possible to define different content types for sales orders and sales quotes that are both in the same Microsoft Dynamics NAV table, or a separation for different item categories.

seg-source.mrk: A Microsoft Dynamics NAV Table Filter defines the display of the content type in the DocumentBox only for appropriate records that meet the filter criteria.
Thereby is it possible to define different content types for sales orders and sales quotes that are both in the same Microsoft Dynamics NAV table, or a separation for different item categories.

trans-unit.source: : Microsoft Dynamics NAV Table Filter Worksheet

seg-source.mrk: : Microsoft Dynamics NAV Table Filter Worksheet

trans-unit.source: Defines the source of the filter value, as further indicated in the Default Value / Field field. The options are:

The options are:

trans-unit.source: Const – Enter a user-defined value (constant) that will be used as a fixed filter value (such as document type). The class corresponds as SETRANGE.

seg-source.mrk: Const – Enter a user-defined value (constant) that will be used as a fixed filter value (such as document type).
The class corresponds as SETRANGE.

trans-unit.source: Field – Use the lookup in the Default Value / Field field to select a field value of the current record (table setup) that will be used as the filter value.

seg-source.mrk: Field – Use the lookup in the Default Value / Field field to select a field value of the current record (table setup) that will be used as the filter value.

trans-unit.source: Filter – Enter a Microsoft Dynamics NAV filter value to define ranges. The class corresponds as SETFILTER.

The class corresponds as SETFILTER.

The options are: User ID, Workdate, System Date, System Time, Company Code.

trans-unit.source: DMS Table Setup Actions

seg-source.mrk: DMS Table Setup Actions

trans-unit.source: There are three additional actions on the DMS Table Setup FastTab. Each is described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: There are three additional actions on the DMS Table Setup FastTab.
Each is described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Action

seg-source.mrk: Action

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: Status > Release

seg-source.mrk: Status > Release

trans-unit.source: Releases the selected table setup line(s).

seg-source.mrk: Releases the selected table setup line(s).

trans-unit.source: Status > Reopen

seg-source.mrk: Status > Reopen

trans-unit.source: Reopens the selected table setup line(s).

seg-source.mrk: Reopens the selected table setup line(s).

trans-unit.source: Functions > Copy from Table Setup

seg-source.mrk: Functions > Copy from Table Setup

trans-unit.source: Copies the line(s) from an existing table setup to the selected table setup.

seg-source.mrk: Copies the line(s) from an existing table setup to the selected table setup.
